articles.title: Indian talent moving to Canada due to outdated H-1B visa policy, US lawmakers told - The Indian Express
articles.description: Highly skilled foreign nationals, including international students, are choosing Canada over America, executive director of National Foundation for American Policy Stuart Anderson said.
articles.content: The much sought-after Indian talent is now getting attracted towards Canada in large numbers, away from the United States because of its outdated H-1B visa policy, immigration and policy experts have… [+5549 chars]

articles.title: Rents Are Out Of Reach For Most Americans Earning Minimum Wage, A Study Says - NPR
articles.description: Workers simply don't earn enough money to keep up with skyrocketing rental rates across the country, the National Low Income Housing Coalition found in its latest Out of Reach report.
articles.content:
A new study says on average someone would have to earn $24.90 per hour to rent a modest two-bedroom home on no more than 30% of their pay. That's far more than the federal minimum wage.
Rich Pedronc… [+2565 chars]

articles.title: America's deep political fissures could cost the country its perfect credit rating - CNN Philippines
articles.description: Fitch Ratings warned on Tuesday that the United States could lose its perfect credit rating due in part to the ongoing assault on democracy and worsening political polarization.
articles.content:

articles.description: A quarter who'd gotten the vaccine after initial hesitation said they had been reassured to see other people getting vaccinated without ill effects.
